Posts.Content: Hi Ann Thanks for your replies, lol. Champagne sounds a great idea! good luck with your radiotherapy Emma x
Posts.Title: Lots of questions!

Posts.Content: Hi Gay Thanks for your reply. I’m to much of a chicken for the cold cap Emma xx
Posts.Title: Lots of questions!

Posts.Content: hi all I’m hoping if some of you could answer a few questions I have firstly I have been diagnosed with grade 3 invasive ductal Breast cancer ER+ PR+ HER2 negative. I have had a therapeutic mammoplasty and axillary clearance. 2 tumours (very small) and 2 lymph nodes affected. I have my first oncology appointment on the 30th October, does anyone have any idea of what type of chemotherapy drugs I will be given? Just so I have a vague idea of what to expect. Also how soon after the oncology appointment have people had to wait to start chemo after that appointment?  Also how soon after chemotherapy does your hair start to fall out? I’ve decided to just shave it all off before it starts falling out, I don’t want to do it to soon as my hair grows really quickly. I have always had short hair and have been having it cut shorter and shorter each time I have it cut. I don’t want my children seeing my hair fall out so once it’s gone it’s gone over and done with. Lol Emma x
Posts.Title: Lots of questions!

Posts.Content: Hi R thanks for your reply, i'll take a look at the link. Emma xx
Posts.Title: Lots of questions!

Posts.Content: Thank you Jess I'll take a look
Posts.Title: Mucositis

Posts.Content: Thank you mistymoley and Helen, I'm going to have a good chat with my oncologist.
Posts.Title: Mucositis

Posts.Content: Sorry should of said Karen and Helen.
Posts.Title: Mucositis

Posts.Content: Hi all I had my 3rd Fec chemo last week, I'm having 6 FEC cycles no T. Has anyone had trouble with mucositis? Mine has got worse with each cycle, from what I've researched it's the F part that's doing it. It's now almost unbearable (sticky saliva) I've tried everything to make it bearable but I'm struggling. Everything I eat or drink is making me gag! Has anyone dropped the F part of their chemo? Thanks Emma
Posts.Title: Mucositis

Posts.Content: Hi Helen I'm also being treated at the RUH. What stage of treatment are you on? Emma xx
Posts.Title: Choosing not to have axillary node clearance

Posts.Content: dippydaisy Hi Emma, I'm on the chemo stage at the moment. I had my first session of FEC on Thursday 24th August. I've got 2 more FECs then 3 lots of T to go. Then radiotherapy. How about you? Helen xx hi Helen I have had, lumpectomy with reconstruction and node clearance. Was supposed to start chemo in the next week or so but histology showed a further very small lump in the margin, so I had to have an MRI to see if there was any more, turns out I have another lymph node affected (1 out of the 2 I have left!). So I'm back in for surgery on the 15th sept for more margin to be taken out around the 2nd lump and the affected lymph node taken out. Then it's chemo, radiotherapy for me too. Maybe we will see each other around the hospital, I seem to be there a lot at the moment! I've started calling it my second home! Emma xx
Posts.Title: Choosing not to have axillary node clearance

Posts.Content: Hi Tia I also had only 1 node affected but opted for full node clearance, I had 25 removed purely because I wanted the nasty disease out of my body completely. I think it's personal choice, good luck with your treatment. Emma xx
Posts.Title: Choosing not to have axillary node clearance

Posts.Content: Hi The only effects I have had is a bit of sensation loss in my armpit. Emma xx
Posts.Title: Choosing not to have axillary node clearance

Posts.Content: dippydaisy Hi Emma, Hope the additional surgery goes well. I'll still be having chemo up until Christmas and radiotherapy after that. My ancient mother in law is there too at the moment so I know what you mean about a second home!!  Give me a shout sometime when you are in RUH perhaps we can go for a cuppa if you fancy it?  Helen xx Hi Helen That would be lovely. Good luck with your ongoing chemo! Emma xx
Posts.Title: Choosing not to have axillary node clearance

Posts.Content: Hi all, I started taking tamoxifen 4 weeks ago and my hot flushes especially at night have been horrendous! Does anyone else have the same problem and do they go away? I really need a whole nights sleep!! Emma
Posts.Title: tamoxifen - hot flushes

Posts.Content: Hi jo I to posted a facebook status, not one i wanted to do as i don’t usually post personal stuff on there. I did it because if met a friend on the street that I hadn’t seen in a while I felt it wasn’t something I could just come out and tell them. I have had overwhelming love, help and support from so many people after that it’s made it all a bit easier to cope with. Good luck with your treatments. Hugs Emma
Posts.Title: How to tell friends?

Posts.Content: Hi all I've just completed 5 FEC chemo cycles, couldn't manage the whole 6, physically, mentally and emotionally had enough! I was just wondering how long is it before the dry mouth stops? It would be lovely to have a whole conversation with someone without having to constantly sip water! Emma xx
Posts.Title: Dry mouth

Posts.Content: Thank you Lynn xx
Posts.Title: Another lump found

Posts.Content: Hi Carolyn  Thanks for your reply. My histology report says ER+ PR+ HER2 Awaited with high grade DCIS, doesn't make much sense to me but might with you. Hopefully the MRI doesn't show any more. Emma xx
Posts.Title: Another lump found

Posts.Content: Hi. I was beginning to think I was the only one. Glad you are ok now. I just hope they don't find any more on the MRI scan. Best wishes  Emma xx
Posts.Title: Another lump found

Posts.Content: Hi all, when I went to see the surgeon after my lumpectomy, reconstruction and lymph node clearance she told me that in the clearance she took out around my original lump there was another but she didn't get full clearance as it was only spotted after the removal. I have to go for an MRI to check there is no more then back in for surgery again. Which puts starting chemo 6 weeks behind. Luckily only 1 out of 25 nodes removed was affected. Has anyone else experienced having more than 1 lump?
Posts.Title: Another lump found
